name: CleanSweep Installation Log
summary: Learn about .IIL files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: CleanSweep was a program that allowed users to monitor, compress, move, and uninstall programs. It was available as both a standalone product and as part of the Norton SystemWorks software suite.

After scanning, altering, or removing a program, CleanSweep produced an IIL file, which recorded the actions it had taken. Users could review these logs to note what changes CleanSweep had made to a program, as well as any other information CleanSweep had noted about that program.

description: An IIL file is a log file created by Norton CleanSweep, a program removal tool for Windows. It contains information about programs and files that CleanSweep scanned, altered, or removed. IIL files are plain text files, which you can open in any text editor.

instructions: You can open IIL files and view the CleanSweep logs they contain with Microsoft Notepad (Windows), Apple TextEdit (Mac), or any other text editor. Note that CleanSweep itself is discontinued.
